Usage example for StartUp: @snippet Form1.cs StartUp example

member.name: P:XRAYWorXBase.LimitableAutoCommand.LimitedKV
member.summary: Set this value to limit the StartUp or Refresh command.

If this value is set, the command is limited and will be executed only until the given high voltage value.
The value has to be in range of [LimitedKVMin .. MaxKV]

member.name: T:XRAYWorXBase.TubeStates
member.summary: Displays an enumeration with the main tube states.
member.remarks: For additional helper methods see TubeStatesExtension.

member.name: F:XRAYWorXBase.TubeStates.NotConnected
member.summary: Actually there is no connection established to the plc.

member.name: F:XRAYWorXBase.TubeStates.Init
member.summary: Tube is initializing. Parameters will be read. While the tube is initializing it is not allowed to send any commands to the tube.

member.name: F:XRAYWorXBase.TubeStates.WaitingForHardware
member.summary: Parameters are read. Hardware infos will be gathered. It is allowed to read parameter data.

member.name: F:XRAYWorXBase.TubeStates.PreOperational
member.summary: Hardware informations are ok. Tube is ready to be started. ITubeInterface.StartUp and ITubeInterface.Refresh are now allowed.

member.name: F:XRAYWorXBase.TubeStates.Operational
member.summary: Tube is operational. All commands are available.

member.name: F:XRAYWorXBase.TubeStates.ProcessingAutoFunc
member.summary: An auto-function (ITubeInterface.StartUp, ITubeInterface.Refresh, ITubeInterface.FilamentAdjust, ITubeInterface.ChangingTarget, ...) is active.

member.name: F:XRAYWorXBase.TubeStates.LimitedOpNoFilAdj
member.summary: Tube is not fully operational. There is no ITubeInterface.FilamentAdjust command executable. Maximum highVoltage is limited.

member.name: F:XRAYWorXBase.TubeStates.LimitedOpFilAdj
member.summary: Tube is not fully operational. ITubeInterface.FilamentAdjust command is executable. Maximum high voltage is limited.

member.name: F:XRAYWorXBase.TubeStates.WaitingForCentering
member.summary: ITubeInterface.Centering expired. New centering required.

member.name: F:XRAYWorXBase.TubeStates.WaitingForStartUp
member.summary: ITubeInterface.StartUp expired. New Start-Up required.

member.name: F:XRAYWorXBase.TubeStates.Error
member.summary: Tube is in an error state. Read the error information carefully. A restart of the plc is requested.

Generally the access to the tube (values and commands) is managed via this interface. For each command (e.g. Start-Up) and for each value which might be monitored or set there is a corresponding object provided.
ITubeInterface is provided by ITubeLoader: @snippet Form1.cs Get Default TubeInterface

members.member:
Set XRayOff.PcDemandValue to true to turn off x-ray. To monitor whether x-ray is off, use XRayOff.MonitorValue.
Returns an object of type TubeCommand<DemandType, MonitorType>.
XRayOff.MonitorValue is true, if x-ray is off, false elsewise. @snippet Form1.cs tubeInterface_XRayOff

Set XRayOn.PcDemandValue to true to turn on x-ray. The plc has to be in Operational-State for turning on x-ray on demand. To monitor whether x-ray is on, use XRayOn.MonitorValue.
Returns an object of type TubeCommand<DemandType, MonitorType>.
XRayOn.MonitorValue is true, if x-ray is on, false elsewise. @snippet Form1.cs tubeInterface_XRayOn

member.summary: Set this command to specify whether the tube is controlled via , or (default).
member.remarks:
Returns a TubeCommand<DemandType, MonitorType>.
For further information see .

member.name: P:XRAYWorXBase.TurbopumpCommand.AutoVentilation
member.summary: Provides access to the tube's turbopump.
member.remarks:
If AutoVentilation is set to true, a ventilation of the tube is automatically initiated after the turbopump is switched off.
If AutoVentilation is set to false, no ventilation will be initiated after switching off the turbopump.
